byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and NICK CORASANITI

abstract: Donald Trump's campaign releases first television advertisement for general election, offering dark and dystopian vision of country under Hillary Clinton that stands in stark contrast to those produced by Clinton's campaign portraying America as hopeful melting-pot; ad is in part acknowledgment by his campaign that it has suffered by ceding television airtime to Clinton and her allies.

headline.print_headline: Trump Buys First Ad of General Election, but Trails in Spending in 4 Crucial States
headline.main: Donald Trump Enters Ad Wars Trailing Hillary Clinton in Spending

snippet: Mr. Trump, in his first ad buys of the general election, has reserved nearly $5 million in ads in four battleground states — compared with Mrs. Clinton’s $13 million....
lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump, in his first ad buys of the general election, has reserved nearly $5 million in ads in four battleground states — compared with Mrs. Clinton’s $13 million.
